newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela reiterates oil windfall to pay debt only.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela reiterates oil windfall to pay debt only.

text.p: The Venezuelan government reiterated that windfall oil revenues will only be used to repay the country's foreign debt.
Planning Minister Teodoro Petkoff was quoted in the local press Sunday as saying that "to use this money for other local purposes would fuel inflation."
Government officials have said that higher-than-budgeted oil prices boosted by recent tension in the Middle East will bring in windfall revenues of up to $3.0 billion this year.
Petkoff said the money will go "to the special debt repayment fund; to put it in circulation ... would only fuel inflation."

Venezuela's inflation rate was 4.2 percent in October, up from 3.6 percent in September but below a 12.6 percent peak in May, following the launch mid-April of an IMF-backed economic adjustment program.
